Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Australia has built power plants and major water projects during the period of population growth.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Australia doubled its population without building a single new power station or major water project.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that population growth must be accompanied by the construction of new power plants or major water projects, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Australia may have utilized existing infrastructure or implemented alternative methods to meet the needs of the growing population.
